data.title: Mala Htun and Douglas Turner
data.meta_description: Mala Nani Htun and Douglas William Turner were married last evening at the Gerald Peters art gallery in Santa Fe, N.M. Rabbi John T. Feldman officiated.      Dr. Htun, 36, is keeping her name. She is an assistant professor of political science at the New School in New York. She graduated from Stanford University and received a doctorate in political science from Harvard. She is the author of ''Sex and the State: Abortion, Divorce and the Family Under Latin American Dictatorships and Democracies'' (Cambridge University Press, 2003).
data.text:
Mala Nani Htun and Douglas William Turner were married last evening at the Gerald Peters art gallery in Santa Fe, N.M. Rabbi John T. Feldman officiated.

Dr. Htun, 36, is keeping her name. She is an assistant professor of political science at the New School in New York. She graduated from Stanford University and received a doctorate in political science from Harvard. She is the author of "Sex and the State: Abortion, Divorce and the Family Under Latin American Dictatorships and Democracies" (Cambridge University Press, 2003).

The bride's father, Ko Moe Htun, of Honolulu, is an associate professor of mechanical engineering at the University of Hawaii there. Her mother, Helen Muller, of Albuquerque, is a professor of management at the University of New Mexico there.

Mr. Turner, 37, is a Council on Foreign Relations international affairs fellow in Tokyo. He is also the founder and chief executive of DW Turner, a management firm in Albuquerque. He graduated from American University and received a master's degree in international relations from the Free University of Brussels.
